sentences.en: " I was only made to assuage my parents'reproductive vanity,'she says bitterly.
sentences.cn: “ 我来到这个世上只是为了满足我父母的生育虚荣心. ” 她忿忿地说.

sentences.en: Extravagance and vanity had made him coldhearted and selfish.
sentences.cn: 放荡和虚荣使他变得残忍自私.

sentences.en: He was too puffed up with his own importance, too blinded by vanity to accept their verdict on him.
sentences.cn: 他过于骄矜自大，被虚荣心冲昏了头脑，根本不能接受他们对他的意见。
她挖苦的语言刺伤了他的虚荣心.
他的虚荣心随着年龄增长而增加.

sentences.en: Men who use steroids are motivated by sheer vanity.
sentences.cn: 使用类固醇的男人纯粹是受虚荣心的驱使。

sentences.en: Most leaders'vanity causes them to exaggerate their own significance.
sentences.cn: 绝大多数领导人出于虚荣心往往喜欢夸大他们自己的重要地位.

sentences.en: My little vanity, and Steerforth's help, urged me on somehow.
sentences.cn: 我自己那一点点的虚荣心和史朵夫给我的帮助, 却不知怎么鞭策了我.

sentences.en: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.cn: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

sentences.en: She loves to bait him about his male vanity.
sentences.cn: 她爱戏弄他的男性虚荣心.
这个女孩子的虚荣心使我吃惊.

sentences.en: The highest form of vanity is love of fame.
The present little sacrifice of your vanity will afterward be amply repaid.
sentences.cn: 牺牲眼前的一些虚荣,日后就会大有收获.

sentences.en: Vanity and virtue do not go together.
sentences.cn: 虚荣与美德不是共生物.

sentences.en: With my usual vanity, I thought he might be falling in love with me.
sentences.cn: 由于我一贯的虚荣心作祟，我以为他可能爱上了我。

trans.tran_cn: 虚荣，浮华，自负，空虚，无聊的事物，无价值的东西
trans.tran_en: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance
